class_notes:
This class investigates the art and techniques of drawing as relational to printmaking. Printmaking techniques will include woodcuts, collagraphs, monoprints, drypoint etching, and experimental techniques. This class meets one day synchronously and will have asynchronous assignments. 
Architectural Studies minor: studio art course requirement
Online synchronous (50% of classwork asynchronous)
course_description: This course uses the tools/concepts of drawing and printmaking to develop skills in representation and observation. Students will acquire skills with the fundamental of visual observation, and the extrapolation to visual problem solving.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 3686, Section #: 1, Type: ART, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 1-2:15p, Instructor: L. Armstrong, Status: Closed
